ofPoint

This class contains all the information and functionality of a geometrical point. It can be a 2D or 3D point. ofPoint allow users perform graphical operations, set positions and more with a better organization and control.

class methods

  • ~ofPoint()
  • ofPoint(...)
  • set(...)
  • operator-()
  • operator==(...)
  • operator!=(...)
  • operator=(...)
  • operator+(...)
  • operator+=(...)
  • operator-(...)
  • operator-=(...)
  • operator*(...)
  • operator*=(...)
  • operator/(...)
  • operator/=(...)

class variables

  • float x
  • float y
  • float z
  • float v

ofPoint methods

~ofPoint()

void ofPoint::~ofPoint()

↑

ofPoint(...)

void ofPoint::ofPoint(float _x, float _y, float _z)

↑

ofPoint(...)

void ofPoint::ofPoint(const ofPoint & pnt)

↑

set(...)

void ofPoint::set(float _x, float _y, float _z)

Set function allow users to set the position of a point object by giving it a specific value for _x, _y and _z. For example:


ofPoint firstpoint;
firstpoint.set(100,230,50);

now firstpoint = (100,230,50)

↑

operator-()

ofPoint ofPoint::operator-()

Calling - operator we turn x,y,z values of a point object into values of opposite sign. e.g:


ofPoint p;
p.set(10,5,-3);
p = -(p);

Now p=(-10,-5,3)

↑

operator==(...)

bool ofPoint::operator==(const ofPoint & pnt)

== operator allow users know if two points are equal. e.g:


ofPoint p1,p2;
bool equal;
p1.set(10,3);
p2.set(5,5);
equal=p1==(p2);

After this equal=false;

↑

operator!=(...)

bool ofPoint::operator!=(const ofPoint & pnt)

!= operator allow users know if two points are different. e.g:


ofPoint p1,p2;
bool dif;
p1.set(10,3);
p2.set(5,5);
dif=p1!=(p2);

After this dif=true;

↑

operator=(...)

ofPoint & ofPoint::operator=(const ofPoint & pnt)

= operator makes the current ofPoint a copy of another ofPoint. e.g:


ofPoint p1,p2;
p1.set(10,10,10);
p2= p1;

p1 and p2 are now identical.

↑

operator=(...)

ofPoint & ofPoint::operator=(const float & val)

= operator sets x, y and z variables of an ofPoint object to val. e.g:


ofPoint p1;
p1.set(1,2,3);
p1 = 5.3;

After this p1=(5.3,5.3,5.3);

↑

operator+(...)

ofPoint ofPoint::operator+(const ofPoint & pnt)

  • operator perform the addition between two points. (x1,y1,z1)+(x2,y2,z2)=(x1+x2,y1+y2,z1+z2) e.g:

ofPoint p1,p2,result;
p1.set(1,2,3);
p2.set(2,1,0);
result = p1 + p2;

After this result=(3,3,3)

↑

operator+(...)

ofPoint ofPoint::operator+(const float & val)

  • Operator performs the arithmetic addition of val and point components. Considering p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z);

ofPoint p1;
...
p1=p1+5;

Now p1=(p1x+5,p1y+5,p1z+5)

↑

operator+=(...)

ofPoint & ofPoint::operator+=(const ofPoint & pnt)

Considering two points p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and p2=(p2x,p2y,p2z) the operator += performs the following operation:


ofPoint p1,p2;
...
p1+=p2;

Now p1=(p1x+p2x,p1y+p2y,p1z+p2z);

↑

operator+=(...)

ofPoint & ofPoint::operator+=(const float & val)

Considering a point p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and a value val. The operator += performs the following operation:


ofPoint p1;
float val;
...
p1+=val;

Now p1=(p1x+val,p1y+val,p1z+val);

↑

operator-(...)

ofPoint ofPoint::operator-(const ofPoint & pnt)

Considering two points p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and p2=(p2x,p2y,p2z) the operator - performs the arithmetic substraction between two points: p1-p2=(p1x-p2x,p1y-p2y,p1z-p2z)

↑

operator-(...)

ofPoint ofPoint::operator-(const float & val)

Considering two points p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and a value val the operator - performs the arithmetic substraction between each point coordinate and the value: p1-val=(p1x-val,p1y-val,p1z-val)

↑

operator-=(...)

ofPoint & ofPoint::operator-=(const ofPoint & pnt)

Considering two points p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and p2=(p2x,p2y,p2z) the operator -= performs the following operation:


ofPoint p1,p2;
...
p1-=p2;

Now p1=(p1x-p2x,p1y-p2y,p1z-p2z);

↑

operator-=(...)

ofPoint & ofPoint::operator-=(const float & val)

Considering a point p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and a value val. The operator -= performs the following operation:


ofPoint p1;
float val;
...
p1-=val;

Now p1=(p1x-val,p1y-val,p1z-val);

↑

operator*(...)

ofPoint ofPoint::operator*(const ofPoint & pnt)

Considering two points p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and p2=(p2x,p2y,p2z) the operator * performs the arithmetic multiplication for each point component: p1p2=(p1xp2x,p1yp2y,p1zp2z)

↑

operator*(...)

ofPoint ofPoint::operator*(const float & val)

Considering two points p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and a value val the operator * performs the arithmetic multiplication between each point coordinate and the value: p1val=(p1xval,p1yval,p1zval)

↑

operator*=(...)

ofPoint & ofPoint::operator*=(const ofPoint & pnt)

Considering two points p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and p2=(p2x,p2y,p2z) the operator *= performs the following operation:


ofPoint p1,p2;
...
p1*=p2;

Now p1=(p1xp2x,p1yp2y,p1z*p2z);

↑

operator*=(...)

ofPoint & ofPoint::operator*=(const float & val)

Considering a point p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and a value val. The operator *= performs the following operation:


ofPoint p1;
float val;
...
p1*=val;

Now p1=(p1xval,p1yval,p1z*val)

↑

operator/(...)

ofPoint ofPoint::operator/(const ofPoint & pnt)

Considering two points p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and p2=(p2x,p2y,p2z) the operator / performs the arithmetic division for each point component: p1/p2=(p1x/p2x,p1y/p2y,p1z/p2z)

↑

operator/(...)

ofPoint ofPoint::operator/(const float & val)

Considering two points p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and a value val the operator / performs the arithmetic division between each point coordinate and the value: p1/val=(p1x/val,p1y/val,p1z/val)

↑

operator/=(...)

ofPoint & ofPoint::operator/=(const ofPoint & pnt)

Considering two points p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and p2=(p2x,p2y,p2z) the operator /= performs the following operation:


ofPoint p1,p2;
...
p1/=p2;

Now p1=(p1x/p2x,p1y/p2y,p1z/p2z);

↑

operator/=(...)

ofPoint & ofPoint::operator/=(const float & val)

Considering a point p1=(p1x,p1y,p1z) and a value val. The operator /= performs the following operation:


ofPoint p1;
float val;
...
p1/=val;

Now p1=(p1x/val,p1y/val,p1z/val)

↑

ofPoint variables

float x

float ofPoint::x

Variable x contains the x coordinate of our ofPoint object.
↑

float y

float ofPoint::y

Variable y contains the y coordinate of our ofPoint object.
↑

float z

float ofPoint::z

Variable z contains the z coordinate of our ofPoint object.
